results.deck: Chat and play board games using EyeToy to connect with your friends and family.
results.name: EyeToy: Chat

results.deck: Play as Dante, son of the legendary dark knight Sparda, as he takes on the emperor of the demon world, Mundus. With help from the lovely Trish, the Force Edge and his guns, Ebony and Ivory.
results.name: Devil May Cry

results.deck: The X-Men must battle the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants and the Sentinels as they attempt to make the world a better place for Mutants and humans alike.
results.name: X-Men: Legends

results.deck: A more action-orientated sequel to the original Elevator Action.
results.name: Elevator Action Returns

results.deck: Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance is a hack-and-slash adventure set in Dungeons and Dragons' Forgotten Realms universe.
results.name: Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance

results.deck: In a world distorted by a cataclysm, an amnesiac, mute young man must explore the halls of the Neuro-Tower to unearth what caused the disaster and how his own past ties into the events. Originally released in 1998, it wasn't released outside of Japan until 2008.
results.name: Baroque

results.deck: Play snooker, pool, or a variety of classic minigames in this sequel to 1991's Jimmy White's Whirlwind Snooker.
results.name: Jimmy White's 2: Cueball

results.deck: A Real Time Strategy game based in the Aliens and Predator universe, the game lets you play three different campaign modes. Predator, Alien, and Marines. The three different campaigns have different gameplay elements.
results.name: Aliens Versus Predator: Extinction

results.deck: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai 3 is a video game developed by Dimps based on the hit anime series, Dragonball Z. The third game in the Budokai series contains characters from the entire series including movie characters and some from GT.
results.name: Dragon Ball Z: Budokai 3

results.deck: Prisoner Of War is an action adventure game set in World War II,  where you must escape various Nazi Prisoner Camps by using Stealth and Cunning.
results.name: Prisoner of War

results.deck: Yakuza 2 is a free-roaming action-adventure brawler which is a continuation of the original Yakuza game on the PlayStation 2. The game is set 1 year after the first game in Osaka,  Japan and follows the exploits of Kiryu Kazuma as he tries to settle a gang war.
results.name: Yakuza 2

results.deck: The seventh rendition of the popular, long running soccer simulator Pro Evolution Soccer. The game is available on PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, PlayStation Portable, Wii, Nintendo DS, Xbox 360, and PC.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2008

results.deck: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger is a 3D platformer made by Krome Studios. In it, Ty travels around the Australian outback in search of five mystical talismans that will not only save his family from the Dreamworld, but his entire species from the wrath of Boss Cass.
results.name: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger

results.deck: Ford Racing 2 expands over it´s predecesor by adding more cars and tracks, new game modes and detailed graphics; a game marketed mostly for the hardcore Ford enthusiast.
results.name: Ford Racing 2

results.deck: FlatOut is a demolition derby-style racing game with destructible cars and environments.
results.name: FlatOut

results.deck: Sega Ages 2500 Vol. 16: Virtua Fighter 2 is essentially a remake of Virtua Fighter 2 for the Sega Saturn.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.16: Virtua Fighter 2

results.deck: Monster Hunter is a RPG for the PlayStation 2 in which you play as a Hunter who hunts monsters
results.name: Monster Hunter

results.deck: Hack-n-Slash your way through the land of Norrath as you master weapon and spell combat to conquer evil.
results.name: Champions of Norrath

results.deck: A fighting game developed and published by SNK. It is the direct sequel to the original Art of Fighting while using a slightly-improved version of the original mechanics.
results.name: Art of Fighting 2

results.deck: Join Gabe Logan and others in an effort to take out the Syphon Filter once more in this online based shooter.
results.name: Syphon Filter: The Omega Strain

results.deck: Join Peter, Stewie, Brian and the rest of the Griffins, and stop Mr. Belvedere's evil plans, help Stewie take over the world, and help clear Brian's name. Verse opponents seen in such episodes as "Emission Impossible", "Sibling Rivalry", and "Screwed the Pooch".
results.name: Family Guy Video Game!

results.deck: The third 3D worms game improves on its predecessor with more options and more mayhem.
results.name: Worms 4: Mayhem

results.deck: EA's 2002 entry in the NBA Live series, featuring New Jersey Nets point guard Jason Kidd on the cover. A separate soundtrack disk was included, and was given an RIAA Platinum certification when the game sold over a million copies.
results.name: NBA Live 2003

results.deck: The first game to use the "Smackdown vs. Raw" name brings features to the table that are now an industry standard.
results.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW

results.deck: A racing game based on the LEGO franchise, it was the last game developed by Attention to Detail ltd.
results.name: Drome Racers

results.deck: Codemaster's popular cricket franchise returns for a fifth outing. Brian Lara International Cricket 2005 features improved graphics, new modes and fully-licensed ICC tournaments
results.name: Brian Lara International Cricket 2005

results.deck: Play as Coporal Frank Keegan from the 82nd Airborne Division to fight in World War 2.
results.name: Medal of Honor: Vanguard

results.deck: Backyard Wrestling: Don't Try This At Home is a wrestling game where you have to defeat your enemy in the bloodiest way possible.
results.name: Backyard Wrestling: Don't Try This at Home

results.deck: LMA Manager 2002 is a continuation of the succesful series, in which the player manages his chosen soccer team through the soccer leagues, winning the major tournaments and signing players for your team.
results.name: LMA Manager 2002

results.deck: Rune is a third-person action game focused on melee fighting, developed by Human Head Studios and was released in late 2000.
results.name: Rune

results.deck: Burnout 2: Point of Impact is the second game of the Burnout franchise and features intense racing through the United States.
results.name: Burnout 2: Point of Impact

results.deck: The 5th game, taking place between 2070 to 2121, with a narative that spans across every game in the series.
results.name: Front Mission 5: Scars of the War

results.deck: Become the Don by extorting businesses, racketeering, whacking rivals and starting gang wars across the whole of New York City. Welcome to the family.
results.name: The Godfather: The Game

results.deck: Mega Man X: Command Mission is a turn-based role-playing game, diverging from its side-scrolling roots.
results.name: Mega Man X: Command Mission

results.deck: Drakan: The Ancients' Gates is the sequel to the PC hit Drakan: Order of the Flame.
results.name: Drakan: The Ancients' Gates

results.deck: A visual novel game released in 2002 that focuses on a group of people who are trapped in an undersea theme park. Mysterious happenings are abound and time is running out so the group must band together to escape alive.
results.name: Ever17: The Out of Infinity

results.deck: Take control of one of three radically different factions and lay waste to your enemies with advanced technology, powerful magic, or raw brute strength.
results.name: Giants: Citizen Kabuto

results.deck: State of Emergency is a free-roaming action game published by Rockstar Games. It features tons of crazy weapons and fight moves to beat up anyone that comes in your way.
results.name: State of Emergency
Get Backers Dakkanoku: Ubawareta Mugen Shiro

results.deck: This action RPG for the PlayStation 2 is the sequel to Square's Brave Fencer Musashi. Musashi is summoned once again to save the world from the growing threat posed by Gandrake Enterprises.
results.name: Musashi: Samurai Legend

results.deck: The cover athlete for NCAA 06 is former Michigan Wolverine and Heisman Trophy Winner Desmond Howard.
results.name: NCAA Football 06

results.deck: Sword of Vermillion is an action RPG designed by Yu Suzuki for the Sega Genesis. The original advertising for this game claimed that it had "over 300 hours of gameplay". It was re-released on the Sega Genesis Collection as well as on the Wii's Virtual Console service.
results.name: Sword of Vermilion

results.deck: 24: The Game is a third-person shooter for the PlayStation 2 based on the hit television series 24, as Jack Bauer and the rest of the Counter Terrorist Unit try to foil terrorist attacks in Los Angeles.
results.name: 24: The Game

results.deck: Neo-Geo's version of the R-Type shooter. This game takes place in a futuristic world where humans have colonized space.
results.name: Last Resort

results.deck: ToCA Race Driver 3 is the third installment in the Race Driver series from Codemasters.
results.name: TOCA Race Driver 3

results.deck: This Is Football played a good game of footy on the Playstation. It took on EA's mammoth with some style and flair.
results.name: This is Football

results.deck: Virtual-On Marz is currently the latest game in the Virtual-On series, and it is the only game that is exclusive to consoles. It is based on Virtual-On Force.
results.name: Cyber Troopers Virtual-On Marz

results.deck: Jet Li stars as police officer Kit Yun as he fights his way from Hong Kong to San Francisco to fulfill a dead man's wish.
results.name: Rise to Honor

results.deck: Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare is a survival horror game developed by Darkworks studios and published by Infogrames. The game takes place on 'Shadow Island', and features two main protagonists: Aline Cedrac and Edward Carnby.
results.name: Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare

results.deck: Overview: This was Monster hunter G in Japan that was ported over to the PSP. This includes more content then its PlayStation 2 counterpart including more armor, monsters, and an addition to your own farm and cat chefs that can cook meals before your next mission.
results.name: Monster Hunter Freedom

results.deck: Gran Turismo 4: Prologue is a racing game developed by Polyphony Digital and released in Japan, Southeast Asia and Europe. The game was never released in North America, for reasons unknown.
results.name: Gran Turismo 4: Prologue

results.deck: When you think of the PlayStation 2 as a "lifestyle accessory" your "game" doesn't have to be "interactive" so much as it just has to make onlookers trip balls!
results.name: Moderngroove: Ministry of Sound Edition

results.deck: .hack//QUARANTINE is a role-playing game that simulates being an MMORPG. It is the fourth game in the .hack series, and is the conclusion to this part of the storyline.
results.name: .hack//QUARANTINE - Part 4

results.deck: Pac-Man enters the lucrative world of falling block puzzles.
results.name: Pac-Attack

results.deck: A 2002 Gamecube exclusive (later released for PS2 and XBOX) FPS. It takes place five years after the Die Hard trilogy.
results.name: Die Hard: Vendetta

results.deck: An enhanced edition of Gauntlet Legends, Dark Legacy added more playable characters and levels.
results.name: Gauntlet: Dark Legacy

results.deck: Three brave starfighter pilots. Three unique starfighters. One mission: Save Naboo.  This was the first LucasArts release on the Playstation 2 system.
results.name: Star Wars: Starfighter

results.deck: The last of Sega's NFL 2K series to be released on the Dreamcast, later being ported to other platforms. It was one of the highest rated football games ever released.
results.name: NFL 2K2
Summon Night Ecstasy: Yoake No Tsubasa

results.deck: A 3D character action game for the PS2 that reimagines the 2D sidescroller Rygar.
results.name: Rygar: The Legendary Adventure

results.deck: The Sims: Bustin' Out
results.name: The Sims: Bustin' Out

results.deck: SOCOM 3 is the third game in the successful series for the PS2 that pushed online play to new heights.
results.name: SOCOM 3: U.S. Navy SEALs

results.deck: A 2005 shoot'em up arcade game released by Milestone Inc.
results.name: Chaos Field

results.deck: Based on an Italian comic series where Donald Duck becomes a crime-fighting vigilante called Paperinik, PK: Out of the Shadows sees him donning a mask and tights, as well as an array of gadgets, to stop an invasion of murderous aliens called the Evroniani.
results.name: Disney's PK: Out of the Shadows

results.deck: NHL 2003 didn't introduce many new features, unlike its successor NHL 2004. However, it did introduce the new GameBreaker mode which allowed a player to build up momentum by winning fights, scoring goals or by landing a big hit.
results.name: NHL 2003

results.deck: The ongoing war between the transforming robots continues! Featuring numerous appearances from iconic and playable Autobots and Decepticons, the game focuses on the franchise's continued struggle of Good vs. Evil in the first Transformers franchise game released on the PlayStation 2.
results.name: TransFormers

results.deck: Hidden Invasion is a action/adventure game for the PS2 and GameCube.
results.name: Hidden Invasion

results.deck: Sonic Gems Collection is a compilation of Sonic games, featuring Sonic R, Sonic CD, and Sonic the Fighters. Various unlockable games are also included.
results.name: Sonic Gems Collection

results.deck: Play and explore different worlds in six different modes, in this iteration of the classic puzzle game, Tetris.
results.name: Tetris Worlds

results.deck: Going where no previous James Bond game has been, GoldenEye: Rogue Agent is the first Bond game that breaks all the rules by letting players experience life as a high-rolling, cold-hearted villain and live on the dark side of the Bond universe.
results.name: GoldenEye: Rogue Agent

results.deck: A spinoff from the Grandia series, Grandia Xtreme is a tough RPG with an emphasis on dungeon crawling.
results.name: Grandia Xtreme

results.deck: Sequel to 3D0's Army Men: Sarges Heroes. Sarge and his men (and women) fight the Tans once again.
results.name: Army Men: Sarge's Heroes 2

results.deck: Mashed is a top-down racing game that features a host of tracks, weapons and cars to play in an up to four-player multi-player scrap.  Available on PS2, XBOX and PC.
results.name: Mashed: Drive to Survive

results.deck: Princess Maker 2 puts you in charge of raising a magical princess who is given to you by the gods.
results.name: Princess Maker 2

results.deck: Tales of the Abyss is the eighth main game in the Tales of franchise, telling the story of Luke fon Fabre and his quest to save the world from the sinister Oracle Knights.
results.name: Tales of the Abyss

results.deck: Players take command of the Union or Confederate army and wage war state to state across a strategic map of the United States, directing troops and generals to seize capitol cities or railway hubs and fighting turn based tactical battles with armies purchased at the strategic level.
results.name: The History Channel: Civil War - Great Battles

results.deck: Based on the television show of the same name, this third-person shooter ties the third and fourth season of the show together, putting the player in the shoes of dirty cop Vic Mackey.
results.name: The Shield: The Game

results.deck: A racing game based around the 1999 season of Formula One.
results.name: F1 Racing Championship

results.deck: Spy vs Spy is a remake of the game that was based on the popular Mad Magazine feature from the 1960s
results.name: Spy vs Spy

results.deck: Dragon Ball Z: Sagas is an action Beat em' up based on the popular anime
results.name: Dragon Ball Z: Sagas

results.deck: A PlayStation 2 port of Midway's arcade racer with new play modes and some sim and mini-game features.
results.name: CART Fury: Championship Racing

results.deck: An whimsical arcade shooter for the PlayStation 2 with surprising depth that rewards multiple playthroughs.
results.name: SkyGunner
